intro: Hibbertia empetrifolia subsp. radians, commonly known as the radiate hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, radially symmetric flowers. The species features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellowish-orange flowers with prominent central stamens. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats. This subshrub is often found in coastal and inland regions, thriving in full sun.
